description: Numbers n such that (15^n + 1)/16 is a prime.
links: J. Brillhart et al., Factorizations of b^n +- 1, Contemporary Mathematics, Vol. 22, Amer. Math. Soc., Providence, RI, 3rd edition, 2002.
H. Dubner and T. Granlund, Primes of the Form (b^n+1)/(b+1), J. Integer Sequences, 3 (2000), #P00.2.7.
H. Lifchitz, Mersenne and Fermat primes field
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 15 2000
extensions: a(6)=54449 is a probable prime discovered by _Paul Bourdelais_, Mar 15 2010
a(7)=67489 is a probable prime discovered by _Paul Bourdelais_, Mar 16 2010
a(8)=551927 is a probable prime discovered by _Paul Bourdelais_, Jul 03 2013
